# Alvailable datasets

showDatasets()

# Accessing datasets

Datasets can be accessed with the `getDatasets` function, which returns a list
of TreeSummarizedExperiments:

```{r, message=FALSE}
list_of_datasets <- getDatasets(x = c(1,3,6))
class(list_of_datasets)
length(list_of_datasets)
list_of_datasets[[1]]
```

Or can be directly accessed trough the specific dataset function, which
returns a TreeSummarizedExperiment

```{r, message=FALSE}
tse <- calgaro_2020_16S_gingival_healthy()
tse
```
